name: outlook-add-in-set-signature
title: Use Outlook event-based activation to set the signature
shortDescription: This sample uses event-based activation to run an Outlook add-in when the user creates a new message or appointment.
longDescription: This sample uses event-based activation to run an Outlook add-in when the user creates a new message or appointment. The add-in can respond to events, even when the task pane is not open. It also uses the setSignatureAsync API. If no signature is set, the add-in prompts the user to set a signature, and can then open the task pane for the user.

thumbnails.alt: Screen shot of sample displaying an information bar prompting the user to set up signatures, and sample signature inserted into the email.

references.name: Configure your Outlook add-in for event-based activation
references.description: Without the event-based activation feature, a user has to explicitly launch an add-in to complete their tasks. This feature enables your add-in to run tasks based on certain events, particularly for operations that apply to every item. You can also integrate with the task pane and UI-less functionality.
